title: Massport releases statement on FAA announcement, says Logan Airport will be impacted
author: John Waller
bullets: Massport confirms Logan Airport is among 40 airports affected by a 10% air traffic reduction due to a government shutdown.
The FAA's decision will start impacting flights at Logan Airport from November 7, potentially causing delays and cancellations.
Massport advises passengers to verify flight statuses with airlines before heading to Logan Airport amidst expected disruptions.

title: License plate reader cameras in Brookline? Readers say it’s a bad idea.
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Brookline Select Board paused the proposal to install license plate readers citing privacy concerns and potential for misuse.
66% of 298 survey respondents oppose the license plate cameras, fearing increased surveillance and questioning crime deterrence.
Proponents argue the license plate cameras could deter theft and aid police investigations, citing safety as a primary concern.

title: Former Celtics guard Tony Allen arrested on drug charges
author: The Associated Press
bullets: Former Celtics guard Tony Allen arrested on drug possession charges in Poinsett County, Arkansas.
Allen, 43, was found with marijuana and cocaine during a vehicle stop on Interstate 555.
In 2023, Allen pleaded guilty in a federal health insurance fraud scheme, receiving probation and community service.

title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: Ford truck owners face recurring issues with plastic oil pans, requiring frequent replacements under warranty.
Switching to a metal oil pan on a 2018 F-150 increases repair time and isn't covered under warranty.
Car Doctor advises sticking with standard repairs and hopes for design improvements from Ford.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: New England Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury did not practice Wednesday due to injuries.
Linebacker Christian Elliss also missed practice, while Drake Maye's offense may rely on rookies if injuries persist.
Tampa Bay's injury report includes Mike Evans' absence, with Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving skipping practice.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Bryan Mejia, a Boston youth baseball coach, was arrested for allegedly selling fentanyl to an undercover officer.
Mejia, 31, is charged with felony fentanyl trafficking for allegedly smuggling over 10 grams with a trafficking organization.
He pled not guilty in Roxbury court and was released; Mejia's next court date is December 1 for a hearing.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group is closing its Boston headquarters and switching to a fully remote work model.
Company will close its offices at 3 Center Plaza and 200 Pier 4 Blvd in Boston Seaport.
Cengage, serving 90 million students globally, continues to adapt its operations to modern workforce needs.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Mike Vrabel praised 41 Patriots players for working out during their off day at Gillette Stadium.
The Patriots hold a 7-2 record in the 2025 season and aim to maintain focus despite success so far.
Stefon Diggs emphasized the team's commitment to improving and not becoming complacent with their record.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, found dead on Colonial Drive in Beverly, identified by officials.
Police responded around 9:40 p.m. Monday, finding both victims with apparent gunshot wounds, deemed an apparent murder-suicide.
Beverly police, Massachusetts State Police, and the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner are investigating the incident.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis, linked to James 'Whitey' Bulger, sentenced to 15 years for 1984 and 1993 manslaughter charges.
Lewis pleaded guilty to killing Brian Watson in 1984 and William Villani in 1993, reducing charges from first-degree murder.
The guilty plea was a compromise due to risks of trial; both cold cases are now officially closed.
